item.title: Go RESTful API pt.4 - GitLab Respository
item.author: Author
item.description: In this post, we are going to set up a GitLab server on GCP. We need a git repository for our CI/CD pipeline. You might ask, there is a native GCP service called, Cloud Source Repository, why don’t we just use that. Of course we can use that, but Source Repository lacks a lot of features like merge request, UI for code reviewing etc. In addition, we can learn how to set up our own GitLab Server and configure its domain and SSL, how cool is that.

item.title: Go RESTful API pt.3 - Running App on GKE
item.author: Author
item.description: On the previous post, we have already build our Docker image and succefully run it on our local computer. Right now, we are going to learn some basic knowledge of Google Kubernetes Engine and how to deploy our service to it. Kubernetes Kubernetes(k8s) is an open source system for users to manage their containerized applications. Why do we need Kubernetes? Kubernetes is a system that makes sure our containers are running as we expected.

item.title: Dependency Inversion Principle
item.author: Author
item.description: I accidently knew the concept of Dependency Inversion Principle(DIP) when I was developing a project. Its definition: High level modules should not depend on low level modules; both should depend on abstractions. Abstractions should not depend on details. Details should depend on abstractions.
